title: Why a Top-Ranked Pimco Fund Is Betting on Bank of America and Barclays Stock
text:
Who says regulation doesn’t benefit investors? Growth-stock investors might grumble about reduced profits from banks that must adhere to the 2010 Dodd-Frank reforms and other regulations. But for conservative investors seeking stable income, such measures have proved to be hugely beneficial.

“Bank fundamentals are the best they’ve been in decades,” says Philippe Bodereau, manager of the Pimco Preferred and Capital Securities fund (ticker: PFANX), which specializes in income-paying bank preferred stocks and their European...
description: The Pimco Preferred and Capital Securities fund is benefiting from banks' strong balance sheets as a result of heightened regulation. The fund favors Bank of America, Banco Santander, and Barclays, among others.
